Currently the call you mention is under OnRunning (which I did just to imitate the way you implemented it for the stationkeeping plugin--but let me know if it should go somewhere else).

content.raw: Could you double check that the messages are published? I think you're missing a call to `this->timer.Start()`.
content.html: Could you double check that the messages are published? I think you're missing a call to this->timer.Start().

update.description:
This plugin scores the stationkeeping task using the scoring scheme described in issue #63. See wayfinding\_scoring\_plugin.hh for documentation. The plugin reads a number of waypoints from an sdf file and publishes these to a topic. It then calculates the minimum distance achieved so far between each waypoint and the vehicle \(currently using the same 2D pose distance as the stationkeeping task\). The score is the average of these minimums.

Currently, only the score and the minimums are published. We may also want to publish the current pose distance between the vehicle and all waypoints.
update.title: Wayfinding task

content.raw: OK, should be fixed. Thanks, @caguero for all the helpful fixes!
content.html: OK, should be fixed. Thanks, @caguero for all the helpful fixes!

content.raw:
I suspect that you are correct - that renaming from VMRC to VRX is causing a bit of a struggle.

I’d suggest a bit of a work around…

1. Create a new branch from default \(with new vrx\_gazebo directory\) 
2. Copy your source files \(\*.cc, \*.hh, etc.\)from the current wayfinding\_task branch to this new branch
3. Test and then create a new PR
4. Assuming all is well we can abandon this PR

There is probably a smoother way to do this with mercurial, but I don’t think it would be too complicated to just make the changes by hand.
content.html:
I suspect that you are correct - that renaming from VMRC to VRX is causing a bit of a struggle.

I’d suggest a bit of a work around…

  1. Create a new branch from default (with new vrx_gazebo directory)
  2. Copy your source files (*.cc, *.hh, etc.)from the current wayfinding_task branch to this new branch
  3. Test and then create a new PR
  4. Assuming all is well we can abandon this PR

There is probably a smoother way to do this with mercurial, but I don’t think it would be too complicated to just make the changes by hand.

content.raw: Looking through the recent commits, I think what happened is that the vrx branch was merged into the default and this eliminated the directories my merge request was attempting to update. I’m not sure what the best way to fix this is. Do you have any suggestions?
content.html: Looking through the recent commits, I think what happened is that the vrx branch was merged into the default and this eliminated the directories my merge request was attempting to update. I’m not sure what the best way to fix this is. Do you have any suggestions?
